snippet: The bipartisan measure, which Mr. Obama hailed as “a Christmas miracle,” shrinks the federal role in education and returns power to states and local districts.
abstract: Pres Obama signs into law Every Student Succeeds Act, overhaul of No Child Left Behind Act; bipartisan bill retains federally mandated standardized testing from original law, but gets rid of punitive consequences for states and school districts that perform poorly.
lead_paragraph: The bipartisan measure, which Mr. Obama hailed as “a Christmas miracle,” shrinks the federal role in education and returns power to states and local districts.

headline.main: President Obama Signs Into Law a Rewrite of No Child Left Behind
headline.print_headline: Revamping of No Child School Act Is Signed
